normalised: A successful campus hiring program requires meticulous planning, from defining clear eligibility criteria (for example, minimum C G P A, no backlogs) to crafting engaging pre-placement talks. The selection process often involves aptitude tests, technical interviews, and group discussions. Candidates may be offered roles ranging from software engineers to management trainees, with compensation packages varying depending on the role and the company. Typical starting salaries can range from rupee three lakhs to rupee fifteen lakhs per annum.

unnormalised: A successful campus hiring program requires meticulous planning, from defining clear eligibility criteria (e.g., minimum CGPA, no backlogs) to crafting engaging pre-placement talks. The selection process often involves aptitude tests, technical interviews, and group discussions. Candidates may be offered roles ranging from software engineers to management trainees, with compensation packages varying depending on the role and the company. Typical starting salaries can range from Rs. 3 Lakhs to Rs. 15 Lakhs per annum.
normalised: Beyond salary, factors like career growth opportunities, work culture, and location (for example, postings in Bangalore, Chennai, or Pune) influence candidate decisions. Many companies are also focusing on diversity and inclusion in their campus hiring efforts, aiming to create a workforce that reflects the rich tapestry of India. Companies are now even offering perks like accommodation in well-maintained living spaces, often around one thousand square feet in area, close to the office.
